Belgium:
Decree of 29 Prairial, Year IV establishes civil registration of births, marriages and deaths throughout what is now Belgium.
Moveables and archives of the guilds of Brussels sold at public auction on the Grand Place.
Chile: Governor Ambrosio O'Higgins officially begins the repopulation of Osorno atop the city ruins discovered in 1792. The city had previously been destroyed by the indigenous mapuche in 1602.
China: The Qianlong Emperor abdicated in favor of his son the Jiaqing Emperor. White Lotus Rebellion: White Lotus began an armed rebellion against the Qing dynasty.
Germany: Rhine Campaign of 1796: Austria declared that its truce with French forces in the area of the Rhine was over effective 31 May.
Haiti:
Toussaint rescued French commander Laveaux from mulatto rebel Villatte; Laveaux appointed Toussaint the Lieutenant-Governor of Saint-Domingue.
The Third Civil Commission, comprising Sonthonax, Roume, Giraud, Leblanc, and Julien Raymond, arrived in Saint-Domingue to establish diplomatic relations between France and the colony.
India: Ching-Thang Khomba moves Manipur's capital to Kangla
Italy:
Napoleon Bonaparte and his French Army of Italy invade Italy.
Napoleon defeats József Alvinczi at the Battle of Arcole.
Russia: Persian Expedition of 1796: Catherine launched a military expedition to punish Persia for its incursion into the Russian protectorate of Kartl-Kakheti. Catherine suffered a stroke in the bathtub. Catherine died. The throne fell to her son, Paul I.
